title: Letter to Lenin from Kazan MCQ 1

content.question: Which of the following aspects of the immediate historical situation in which the letter was written best explains the author’s demands toward the end of the second paragraph?

choices.label: The Soviet government used the pretext of the ongoing civil war to engage in repressive policies against entire sections of its population.
Soviet leaders scrambled for influence as they sought to replace an ailing Vladimir Lenin.
The implementation of the first Five Year Plan had resulted in widespread famine and high death rates in the Soviet countryside.
Because of Russia’s late industrialization, its working class was numerically small, limiting popular support for the Bolshevik seizure of power.

content.answer: The Soviet government used the pretext of the ongoing civil war to engage in repressive policies against entire sections of its population.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
